newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE nearby canola ends up on commission, local buy.
newsitem.headline: WCE nearby canola ends up on commission, local buy.

text.p: WCE nearby canola ended up on commission and local buying, traders said.

"PCTS bought the March at $403 in the last half hour and prompted local buying, funds sold 200 March, Cargill was selling and crushers bought late in the day," a trader said. March futures crush profit margin rose to -26.59 from -27.43 Thursday on CBOT soyoil, meal. Mar-May spread at $0.30, Mar-July $1, May-July $0.50. Volume was 5,457 lots.
Japan bought 5,000-6,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
March canola rose $1.70 to $403.70, May up $0.90 to $403.50. March flax fell $0.80 to $342. Mar-May spread $2.50.
February western barley was unchanged at $139.30, March unchanged at $137.20 on commission short covering. Feb-Mar spread at $2, Feb-July $5. Volume was 1,000 lots.
March feed wheat rose $0.50 to $170, May rose $0.50 to $166.10 on local, commission short covering. Mar-May spread at $4, July-Dec $7, Mar-July $7.50. Volume was 320 lots.
PCTS sold May feed pea contracts unchanged at US$197 to UGG which also bought December unchanged at US$187. Volume was 175 lots. Oats did not trade despite commercial offers.
(All values in Canadian dollars except oats and peas.)
